result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lidia Lopez

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lidia Lopez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Clerk JT  Minutes: SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on December 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM. 
No VIOLENT contact and no discussion w/ LLB 12/18/09, JMG 02/09/07, MCP 01/28/20, CLC 08/10/10 and follow any orders in the CHIPS case.*Not To Discuss Case w/ Mario G. P.

2:50 PM
Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State. Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Gardner. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:45 am. $1000 Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). Attorney moves to dismiss count 2. Arguments heard. Court dismisses count 2. ec
and witness list filed by the State
